answers.answer: we don't know and can't tell you if he is lying, this is something you need to talk to him about. If you don't trust him then ask him to get STD tested, you should aas well to learn your status

diabetes can cause fungal infections in the genital area more often - aka jock itch. You don't treat jock itch with doxy.his diabetes will not cause genital and eye issues both at the same time.doxy is not penicillin either.bottom line  you came looking for info because it sounded fishy to you and honestly it sounds fishy to me too.  this is certainly worth talking more to your partner about and if you don't feel that you are getting straight answers, protect yourself with testing.grace

Thank you for the responses. I will trust my instinct. Now I am wondering how long does it take for a std to show up. I did a little bit of online research on that doxycycline medication and one of its uses was for chlamydia. If this itwas he has, how long has he had it and how long does it take to show up? I am on my way to make a doc appt immediately, regardless but the scary thing is that he isn't thinking about me. What if I have it now?

chlamydia is easily treated. you need to wait at least 1 week after the last time you had sex to test for chlamydia and gonorrhea. 6 weeks minimum for syphilis. 3 months for herpes and hiv.have you talked to him yet?

question: Recently my boyfriend says that his diabetes caused him to have itching in his genital area and the feeling if a bump inside his pens. Thus was also associated with his dry eye...so he says.  He goes to doc and they give him doxycycline.  Is he lying or telling the truth. Does he have a std or not? Why would they give him this med? He says its penicillin and should clear things up.help.
title: diabetes ir std
